title: Wives for the Survivors of Benjamin
summary: Judges 21 ends with a troubling solution: to preserve the tribe of Benjamin, the Israelites allow them to abduct women from Shiloh. The book concludes with the statement, ‘Everyone did what was right in his own eyes.’

faq.question: Why were wives needed for the Benjaminites?
faq.answer: Because all their women had been killed during the civil war, threatening the tribe's survival.

faq.question: What phrase ends the book of Judges?
faq.answer: ‘In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.’
